Apteligent.name: Apteligent App
Apteligent.description: This open source app was built for Apteligent to demonstrate how their public api could be utilized.  It was built using React Native, which is written using JavaScript and JSX and then compiled into Objective-C or Java and run as a native application.  One of the major challenges I encountered in building this application was building the graphs, as I was unable to find a suitable graphing library that integrated with React Native, so I had to build my own.  Luckily, the rest of the development process went smoothly. Unfortunately, this app was never released, as not long after development the api was shut down.  However a video of the app in use can be found here.

Trip.name: Tripommendation App
Trip.description: This app is a personal project that is still in development, the basic concept is that it is a place to save all travel recommendations in one place, in groups and with notes, in one place while still utilizing the power of google maps.  It is a hybrid app that is being built using the Ionic v1 framework for the app and Google Firebase for the user authentication and database.  One of the major challenges has been integrating Ionic and Google Maps in a UI that feels modern, this is something I am still working on.  As this app is still in development it has not been released but a video of the app in use can be found here.

Sorting.name: Sorting Algorithms
Sorting.description: This is a simple program, written in Java, that I built to learn some of the fundamental sorting algorithms and to practise writing code in java.

Weather.name: Weather App
Weather.description: This very simple app was built for a Brown Bag showcasing React Native that I presented.  It was built to show how easy and how fast puttting together a native application is using React Native, and how smooth the reload and debugging tools are.
